projects.name: Raxx
projects.description: Web app that makes it easier to visualize and understand crime data. Still WIP

projects.name: Voluntarily
projects.description: Connecting skilled volunteers with classrooms to teach essential tech skills in schools

projects.name: Ubiquity
projects.description: Helping businesses send billions of messages a month to help customers get stuff done

projects.name: Flatbot
projects.description: Facebook Messenger bot for sniping rental listings. Peaked at 100+ users on Messenger purely through word of mouth, but ended up neglected as we explored other pursuits and projects.

projects.name: Qrious
projects.description: As their first design hire, supported multiple internal and external product teams by improving UX processes, as well as facillitating faster design decisions.

projects.name: Mighway
projects.description:
Mighway is a peer-to-peer motorhome platform that connects motorhome owners with tourists who wanted to rent their vehicles.
In my role, I negotiated designs between product, development and marketing teams on a redesign of their onboarding, booking, and internal systems.

projects.name: Infra.nz
projects.description: POC Website that makes it easy to see infrastructure system outages (water, power, internet, cellular service) in your area. Built to learn about mapping frameworks and data visualization for the GovHack 2023 hackathon.

projects.name: Terrible ideas Hackathon
projects.description: The Terrible Ideas hackathon is a 46-hour challenge to create the most terrible, awful, brilliant ideas you can think of. Was part of the organising team from 2020-2022

projects.name: Fruit Tax
projects.description: Proof of concept shopping tech demo that raises the prices of products while you aren't looking. Uses your Webcam and OpenCV.

projects.name: Swearsies
projects.description: Proof of concept swear jar that transfers $5 into your savings account every time your device hears you swear. Built to experiment with Google ML services, and banking APIs for the 2019 BankEngine Hackathon.

projects.name: Pew Pew VR
projects.description: Mobile VR game where you make PEW PEW noises with your mouth to play. Available on the Play Store. Built to play with the unity microphone API at the KiwiJam 2019 Game Jam.

projects.name: Quick Maths
projects.description: 40 player educational multiplayer math deathmatch in the browser. Built to learn about Websockets and the Canvas API at the KiwiJam 2020 Game Jam

projects.name: Ligma.design
projects.description: Hastily assembled clone of Figma that hypothesized what an Adobe acquisition would do to the platform. Resets your work every 90 seconds. Has been used by over 7,400 users.

projects.name: Lenny
projects.description: Proof of concept prototype that uses payment data to perform COVID-19 contact tracing. Built as part of the GovHack 2021 Open Data Hackathon.

projects.name: Check On
projects.description: Proof of concept dashboard for emergencies. It aggregates data from public and private data sources. Built to learn about public datasets for the GovHack 2020 hackathon.

projects.name: Anti-adblocker
projects.description: Working browser implementation of the adblocker from the TV Show Black Mirror. Uses your webcam to tell you to keep watching ads if you stop watching.

projects.name: Matter VR
projects.description: Unity VR experience where you make music with gestural hand controls using a Leap Motion sensor. Built as an excuse to experiment with hand tracking systems and VR.

projects.name: Spicy Hack
projects.description: Sadistic random tech stack generator used to increase hackathon difficulty for veteran developers.

projects.name: Hello Politician
projects.description: Public political disclosure data register put together by scraping PDF files. Built as an excuse to play with govt data for the GovHack 2019 hackathon.

projects.name: Flattie
projects.description: Rental affordability heatmap created by crunching MBIE government data.

projects.name: Senpai
projects.description: Senpai is a simple website blocker that helps you study. Used to learn more about Chrome APIs.

projects.name: Zappy
projects.description: Augmented Reality bus stop finder built with Unity and Google ARCore. Built at an NZTA Government Hackathon to learn more about Unity AR Tooling.

projects.name: Raihana
projects.description: NZTA hackathon project exploring the driver licensing process and how to improve it. Included experiments with eyesight checking features through the browser Webcam API

projects.name: She Sharp
projects.description: Charity website design + dev work for a group serving the next generation of women in tech called She Sharp. Lots of Wordpress, CSS and PHP hackery.

projects.name: NZ Traditional Boatbuilding School
projects.description: Charity website design + dev work for a traditional boatbuilding school. Lots of Wordpress, CSS and PHP hackery.

projects.name: Fundy
projects.description: Hackathon project that explored what charity funding marketplaces could look like. Built for a hackathon hosted by Datacom in 2019.

projects.name: VR Forex Prototype
projects.description: Unity VR Data visualization playing with forex data pulled from the Yahoo finance API

projects.name: VR Traffic Prototype
projects.description: Unity VR data visualization of traffic data over time.

projects.name: Bender
projects.description: Interactive digital art exhibit built with Unity and Microsoft Kinect SDKs. Publicly displayed at Aotea Square in New Zealand in 2015.
